definition: to abandon one's body in the search for Buddha's truth (idiom)
to give up/to abandon/to give alms
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: He is willing to sacrifice himself for his pursuit of truth.
sentences.chinese: 爲了追求真理，他不惜捨身求法。
